ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with coarse facial features, developmental delay, hypotonia, absent speech, and characteristic facial dysmorphisms including tented upper lip. The skeletal anomaly (11 ribs) also fits.
Presents with hirsutism, coarse facial features, developmental delays, hypotonia, and speech delays. Long philtrum and epicanthus are common features.
Characterized by severe intellectual disability, absent speech, hypotonia, and distinctive facial features including tented upper lip vermilion. Motor delays are typical.
Features hirsutism, developmental delays, distinctive facial features including long philtrum, and limb abnormalities. Speech delays and hypotonia are common.
Presents with distinctive facial features, developmental delays, and speech problems. Some patients have skeletal anomalies and hirsutism.
Features include distinctive facial appearance with epicanthus, developmental delays, hypotonia, and skeletal anomalies. Speech delays are common.
Can present with coloboma, heart defects, choanal atresia, growth retardation, genital abnormalities, and ear anomalies. Developmental delays and facial dysmorphisms including epicanthus can occur.
